intro: Thelypodiopsis wootonii var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish to yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Thelypodiopsis wootonii var. parviflora is often found in desert scrub and creosote bush communities.
